paper_abstract: This paper proposed a Neuro-Genetic technique to optimize the multi-response of wire electro-discharge machining (WEDM) process. The technique was developed through hybridization of a radial basis function network (RBFN) and non-dominated sorting genetic algorithm (NSGA-II). The machining was done on 5 vol% titanium carbide (TiC) reinforced austenitic manganese steel metal matrix composite (MMC). The proposed Neuro-Genetic technique was found to be potential in finding several optimal input machining conditions which can satisfy wide requirements of a process engineer and help in efficient utilization of WEDM in industry. (C) 2012 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Multi-objective optimization in wire-electro-discharge machining of TiC reinforced composite through Neuro-Genetic technique
